text: in the early 1600s an Italian got the
ball rollin by measuring and observing
balls rollin Galileo also timed pendulum
and dropped different sized objects of
the Leaning Tower of Pisa to see what
would happen
and despite upsetting the Pope his ideas
that apparently made Gard very cross
Galileo's work became the rock on which
modern physics is found
later free from angry Pope's itec Newton
moved things on by abandoning balls and
embracing apples why he wondered did
they always fall downwards not sideways
or up by 1687 he had an answer it was a
force called gravity which worked on
balls and apples and planets holding
them in nice predictable orbits around
the Sun in the 1800's James Clerk
Maxwell Casas I / more mysteries he
showed her electricity and magnetism are
related and can be combined as one force
electromagnetism all that was left for
to plug a few remaining holes but by
1900 the holes were getting bigger the
latest discoveries didn't build on the
olden
things like x-rays and radioactivity
were just plain weird and in a bad way
top scientist Lord Kelvin saw dark
clouds hanging over the subject then in
1905 a Swiss patent clerk started a
full-on storm each tiny cocoa 26 year
old Albert Einstein tore up the strip
first he claimed that light is a kind of
wave but also comes in packets or
particles in the same year he published
his famous equation e equals mc-squared
it says that mass and energy are
equivalent and if that wasn't shocking
enough he released the mind-blowing
results of a thought experiment so hold
on to your heads
it starts with the assumption that the
speed of light in a vacuum is constant
now imagine that someone watches a
spaceship flying very fast what they
would see is a ship's clocks running
slower than their own watch and the ship
will actually shrink inside
but for the astronauts inside all would
be normal fightin said that time and
space can change they are relative
depending on who's observing them this
is special relativity his ideas
shattered traditional physics he'd open
a door onto the weird world of the
quantum where cat-scan will be alive and
dead where God plays dice and where
everything is uncertain his famous
equation led to nuclear energy with a
special relativity the Large Hadron
Collider will be pointless
general relativity predicted both black
holes and the Big Bang an idea now
endorsed by both church and science
Galileo would have been pleased
well done out
you
